Identification.LongTitle: An Act to implement the Free Trade Agreement between Canada and the Republic of Colombia, the Agreement on the Environment between Canada and the Republic of Colombia and the Agreement on Labour Cooperation between Canada and the Republic of Colombia
Identification.ShortTitle: Canada–Colombia Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Canada–Colombia Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act.
The definitions in this section apply in this Act.

Definition.Text: Agreement means the Free Trade Agreement between Canada and the Republic of Colombia, signed on November 21, 2008.

federal law means the whole or any portion of an Act of Parliament or a regulation, order or other instrument issued, made or established in the exercise of a power conferred by or under an Act of Parliament.
Joint Commission means the Joint Commission established under Article 2001 of the Agreement.
Minister means the Minister for International Trade.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Agreement on the Environment between Canada and the Republic of Colombia, signed on November 21, 2008; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Agreement on Labour Cooperation between Canada and the Republic of Colombia, signed on November 21, 2008.

Section.Text: For greater certainty, this Act and any federal law that implements a provision of the Agreement or a related agreement or fulfils an obligation of the Government of Canada under the Agreement or a related agreement is to be interpreted in a manner consistent with the Agreement or related agreement, as the case may be.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application of Act or Agreement to water
Section.Text: For greater certainty, nothing in this Act or the Agreement applies to natural surface or ground water in liquid, gaseous or solid state.

For greater certainty, nothing in this Act, by specific mention or omission, is to be construed to affect in any manner the right of Parliament to enact legislation to implement any provision of the Agreement or a related agreement or fulfil any of the obligations of the Government of Canada under the Agreement or a related agreement.
This Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The purpose of this Act is to implement the Agreement and the related agreements, the objectives of which, as elaborated more specifically through their provisions, are to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: establish a free trade area in accordance with the Agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: promote, through the expansion of reciprocal trade, the harmonious development of the economic relations between Canada and the Republic of Colombia in order to foster, in Canada and in Colombia, the advancement of economic activity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: provide fair conditions of competition affecting trade between Canada and the Republic of Colombia;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: substantially increase investment opportunities in Canada and the Republic of Colombia;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: contribute, by the removal of barriers to trade, to the harmonious development and expansion of world trade;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: enhance and enforce environmental laws and regulations and strengthen cooperation on environmental matters;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: protect, enhance and enforce basic workers’ rights, strengthen cooperation and build on the respective international commitments of Canada and the Republic of Colombia on labour matters; and

Subsection.Text: No person has any cause of action and no proceedings of any kind shall be taken, without the consent of the Attorney General of Canada, to enforce or determine any right or obligation that is claimed or arises solely under or by virtue of Part 1 or an order made under that Part.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Causes of action under the Agreement or a related agreement
Subsection.Text: Subject to Section B of Chapter Eight of the Agreement and Part Three and Annex 4 of the Agreement on Labour Cooperation between Canada and the Republic of Colombia, signed on November 21, 2008, no person has any cause of action and no proceedings of any kind shall be taken, without the consent of the Attorney General of Canada, to enforce or determine any right or obligation that is claimed or arises solely under or by virtue of the Agreement or a related agreement.

Heading.Label: PART 1
Heading.TitleText: Implementation of the Agreement and the Related Agreements

Section.Text: The Agreement and the related agreements are approved.
The Minister is the principal representative of Canada on the Joint Commission.
The Government of Canada shall pay its appropriate share of the aggregate of any expenditures incurred by or on behalf of the Joint Commission.

Heading.TitleText: Panels, Committees, Subcommittees and Working Groups

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appoint any person to be a representative of Canada on any committee or subcommittee referred to in Annex 2001 of the Agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: appoint any person to be a panelist in accordance with Article 2108 of the Agreement; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: propose candidates to serve as the chair of panels in accordance with that Article.

Section.Text: The Minister shall designate an agency, division or branch of the Government of Canada to facilitate the operation of Chapter Twenty-one of the Agreement and to provide administrative assistance to panels established under that Chapter.
The Government of Canada shall pay the costs of or its appropriate share of the costs of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the remuneration and expenses payable to members of panels, committees, subcommittees and working groups and to the assistants of panel members; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the general expenses incurred by panels, committees, subcommittees and working groups.

Subsection.Text: The Governor in Council may, for the purpose of suspending benefits in accordance with Article 2114 of the Agreement, by order, do any one or more of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: suspend rights or privileges granted by Canada to the Republic of Colombia or to goods of the Republic of Colombia under the Agreement or any federal law;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: modify or suspend the application of any federal law, with respect to the Republic of Colombia or to goods of the Republic of Colombia;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: extend the application of any federal law to the Republic of Colombia or to goods of the Republic of Colombia; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: take any other measure that the Governor in Council considers necessary for that purpose.

Subsection.Text: Unless repealed, an order made under subsection (1) has effect for the period specified in the order.

Section.Text: Pursuant to the Agreement Concerning Annual Reports on Human Rights and Free Trade Between Canada and the Republic of Colombia, the Minister shall cause to be laid before each House of Parliament by May 15 of each year or, if that House is not then sitting, on any of the 30 days next thereafter that it is sitting, a report on the operation of this Act during the previous calendar year, containing a general summary of all actions taken under the authority of this Act, and an analysis of the impact of these actions on human rights in Canada and the Republic of Colombia.

Heading.TitleText: Department of Human Resources and Skills Development Act

Subsection.Text: The provisions of this Act come into force on a day or days to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

No order may be made under subsection (1) unless the Governor in Council is satisfied that the Government of the Republic of Colombia has taken satisfactory steps to implement the Agreement and the related agreements, including providing the Government of Canada with written notification pursuant to Article 3 of the Agreement Concerning Annual Reports on Human Rights and Free Trade Between Canada and the Republic of Colombia and accepting written notification from the Government of Canada pursuant to Article 3 of that Agreement.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Act in force August 15, see SI/2011-55.]
